# Footer component implementation (2025-12-22 05:12Z)

_**User (2025-12-22 20:31Z)**_

@.cursor/rules/hip-component.mdc Lets make a Footer component

Lets start off simple and just implment this https://tailwindcss.com/plus/ui-blocks/marketing/sections/footers#component-2804f3d86cef85d9e040bee6d08633d6-dark

Our footer should be composed of many subcomponents. To start we need

- Footer.Root
- Footer.Section
- Footer.Copyright
- Footer.SocialLinkList
- Footer.SocialLinkItem

---

_**Agent (model default, mode Plan)**_

---

Reviewing the codebase structure and the Tailwind UI example to plan the Footer component.

| Web Search Results |  | To create a structured and reusable Footer component in React using Tailwind CSS, you can define it with the following subcomponents:<br/><br/>- `Footer.Root`: The main container for the footer.<br/>- `Footer.Section`: A section within the footer, such as navigation links or contact information.<br/>- `Footer.Copyright`: Displays copyright information.<br/>- `Footer.SocialLinkList`: A container for social media links.<br/>- `Footer.SocialLinkItem`: An individual social media link.<br/><br/>Here's an example implementation:<br/><br/>```jsx<br/>import React from 'react';<br/><br/>const Footer = \{<br/>  Root: (\{ children \}) => (<br/>    <footer className="bg-gray-800 text-white"><br/>      <div className="container mx-auto px-6 py-4">\{children\}</div><br/>    </footer><br/>  ),<br/>  Section: (\{ title, children \}) => (<br/>    <div className="mb-4"><br/>      <h2 className="text-lg font-semibold">\{title\}</h2><br/>      <div>\{children\}</div><br/>    </div><br/>  ),<br/>  Copyright: (\{ text \}) => (<br/>    <div className="text-center text-sm mt-4">\{text\}</div><br/>  ),<br/>  SocialLinkList: (\{ children \}) => (<br/>    <div className="flex justify-center space-x-4">\{children\}</div><br/>  ),<br/>  SocialLinkItem: (\{ href, icon \}) => (<br/>    <a href=\{href\} className="text-gray-400 hover:text-white"><br/>      \{icon\}<br/>    </a><br/>  ),<br/>\};<br/><br/>export default Footer;<br/>```<br/><br/>**Usage Example:**<br/><br/>```jsx<br/>import Footer from './Footer';<br/>import \{ FaFacebook, FaTwitter, FaInstagram \} from 'react-icons/fa';<br/><br/>function App() \{<br/>  return (<br/>    <div><br/>      \{/* Other components */\}<br/>      <Footer.Root><br/>        <Footer.Section title="About Us"><br/>          <p>Information about the company.</p><br/>        </Footer.Section><br/>        <Footer.Section title="Contact"><br/>          <p>Email: contact@example.com</p><br/>        </Footer.Section><br/>        <Footer.SocialLinkList><br/>          <Footer.SocialLinkItem href="https://facebook.com" icon=\{<FaFacebook />\} /><br/>          <Footer.SocialLinkItem href="https://twitter.com" icon=\{<FaTwitter />\} /><br/>          <Footer.SocialLinkItem href="https://instagram.com" icon=\{<FaInstagram />\} /><br/>        </Footer.SocialLinkList><br/>        <Footer.Copyright text="© 2025 Company Name. All rights reserved." /><br/>      </Footer.Root><br/>    </div><br/>  );<br/>\}<br/><br/>export default App;<br/>```<br/><br/><br/>This structure allows for a modular and maintainable footer component. You can customize the styles and content as needed. For more design inspiration and examples, you can refer to Tailwind CSS's official footer components: ([tailwindcss.com](https://tailwindcss.com/plus/ui-blocks/marketing/sections/footers?utm_source=openai))<br/><br/>Additionally, for a visual guide on creating a footer component with Tailwind CSS, you might find this video tutorial helpful:<br/><br/>[Tailwind CSS - Footer Component](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YCkeuYydHvU&utm_source=openai)<br/> |

Creating the plan for the Footer component:

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="unknown" data-tool-name="create_plan">
<details>
<summary>Tool use: **create_plan**</summary>

Parameters:

```json
{
  "plan": "# Footer Component Implementation\n\n## Overview\nCreate a Footer component with subcomponents following the Tailwind UI dark footer example. The component will be composed of multiple subcomponents that can be used together to build flexible footer layouts.\n\n## Component Structure\n\n### Files to Create\n1. &#96;packages/hip-ui/src/components/footer/index.tsx&#96; - Main component file with all subcomponents\n2. &#96;packages/hip-ui/src/components/footer/footer-config.ts&#96; - Component configuration file\n\n### Files to Modify\n1. &#96;packages/hip-ui/src/cli/install.tsx&#96; - Register footerConfig in COMPONENT_CONFIGS array\n\n### Subcomponents to Implement\n\n1. **Footer.Root** (&#96;&lt;footer&gt;&#96;)\n   - Main container with dark background\n   - Uses semantic color tokens (ui.bgSubtle or ui.bgDim for dark theme)\n   - Responsive padding and layout\n   - Uses Flex or Grid for layout\n\n2. **Footer.Section** (&#96;&lt;div&gt;&#96;)\n   - Container for footer content sections\n   - Supports title/heading (optional)\n   - Vertical spacing between sections\n   - Responsive layout\n\n3. **Footer.Copyright** (&#96;&lt;p&gt;&#96; or &#96;&lt;div&gt;&#96;)\n   - Displays copyright text\n   - Smaller text size\n   - Dimmed text color\n   - Typically centered or aligned\n\n4. **Footer.SocialLinkList** (&#96;&lt;div&gt;&#96; or &#96;&lt;ul&gt;&#96;)\n   - Container for social media links\n   - Horizontal layout with gap\n   - Flex display\n\n5. **Footer.SocialLinkItem** (&#96;&lt;a&gt;&#96; or Link component)\n   - Individual social media link\n   - Icon support (from lucide-react)\n   - Hover states\n   - Uses Link component or extends AriaLink\n\n## Implementation Details\n\n### Styling Approach\n- Use theme tokens from:\n  - &#96;semantic-color.stylex.tsx&#96; for colors (ui.bgSubtle, ui.text, ui.textDim)\n  - &#96;spacing.stylex.tsx&#96; for all spacing values\n  - &#96;typography.stylex.tsx&#96; for font sizes and weights\n  - &#96;radius.stylex.tsx&#96; if rounded corners needed\n- Follow dark theme patterns from Tailwind UI example\n- Use Flex or Grid components for layout when appropriate\n\n### TypeScript Interfaces\n- All components extend &#96;StyleXComponentProps&lt;BaseProps&gt;&#96;\n- Footer.Section should accept optional &#96;title&#96; prop\n- Footer.SocialLinkItem should accept &#96;href&#96;, &#96;icon&#96; (ReactNode), and &#96;ariaLabel&#96; props\n- Footer.Copyright should accept &#96;children&#96; (copyright text)\n\n### Component Composition\n- Export all subcomponents from the same file\n- Follow the pattern used in Card component (separate exports, not nested properties)\n- Use semantic HTML elements (&#96;&lt;footer&gt;&#96;, &#96;&lt;section&gt;&#96;, &#96;&lt;nav&gt;&#96;, etc.)\n\n## Configuration\n\n### footer-config.ts\n- List all theme dependencies used\n- Include any hip component dependencies (Flex, Grid, Link if used)\n- No external dependencies needed (unless using react-aria-components for Link)\n\n### Registration\n- Add &#96;footerConfig&#96; + "use client";
```
```diff
+
+ import * as stylex from "@stylexjs/stylex";
+ import { LinkProps as AriaLinkProps, Link as AriaLink } from "react-aria-components";
+
+ import { Flex } from "../flex";
+ import { mediaQueries } from "../theme/media-queries.stylex";
+ import { ui } from "../theme/semantic-color.stylex";
+ import { spacing } from "../theme/spacing.stylex";
+ import { StyleXComponentProps } from "../theme/types";
+ import { fontFamily, fontSize, fontWeight } from "../theme/typography.stylex";
+
+ const styles = stylex.create({
+   root: {
+     fontFamily: fontFamily["sans"],
+     paddingTop: spacing["12"],
+     paddingBottom: spacing["8"],
+     paddingLeft: spacing["4"],
+     paddingRight: spacing["4"],
+     [mediaQueries.sm]: {
+       paddingLeft: spacing["6"],
+       paddingRight: spacing["6"],
+     },
+     [mediaQueries.lg]: {
+       paddingTop: spacing["16"],
+       paddingBottom: spacing["12"],
+     },
+   },
+   section: {
+     display: "flex",
+     flexDirection: "column",
+     gap: spacing["4"],
+   },
+   sectionTitle: {
+     fontSize: fontSize["sm"],
+     fontWeight: fontWeight["semibold"],
+     textTransform: "uppercase",
+     letterSpacing: "0.05em",
+   },
+   sectionContent: {
+     display: "flex",
+     flexDirection: "column",
+     gap: spacing["2"],
+   },
+   copyright: {
+     fontSize: fontSize["sm"],
+     textAlign: "center",
+     paddingTop: spacing["8"],
+     borderTopWidth: 1,
+     borderTopStyle: "solid",
+     borderTopColor: "transparent",
+   },
+   socialLinkList: {
+     display: "flex",
+     flexDirection: "row",
+     gap: spacing["4"],
+     alignItems: "center",
+   },
+   socialLinkItem: {
+     display: "inline-flex",
+     alignItems: "center",
+     justifyContent: "center",
+     color: {
+       default: ui.textDim.color,
+       ":hover": ui.text.color,
+     },
+     transitionProperty: "color",
+     transitionDuration: "150ms",
+     transitionTimingFunction: "ease-in-out",
+     cursor: "pointer",
+     textDecoration: "none",
+     // eslint-disable-next-line @stylexjs/no-legacy-contextual-styles, @stylexjs/valid-styles
+     ":is(*) svg": {
+       height: "1.25rem",
+       width: "1.25rem",
+     },
+   },
+ });
+
+ /**
+  * Footer root component. Main container for footer content.
+  */
+ export interface FooterRootProps
+   extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;React.ComponentProps&lt;"footer"&gt;&gt; {}
+
+ export const FooterRoot = ({ style, ...props }: FooterRootProps) =&gt; {
+   return (
+     &lt;footer
+       {...props}
+       {...stylex.props(styles.root, ui.bgSubtle, ui.text, style)}
+     /&gt;
+   );
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Footer section component. Container for grouping related footer content.
+  */
+ export interface FooterSectionProps
+   extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;React.ComponentProps&lt;"div"&gt;&gt; {
+   /**
+    * Optional title for the section.
+    */
+   title?: string;
+ }
+
+ export const FooterSection = ({
+   style,
+   title,
+   children,
+   ...props
+ }: FooterSectionProps) =&gt; {
+   return (
+     &lt;div {...props} {...stylex.props(styles.section, style)}&gt;
+       {title &amp;&amp; (
+         &lt;h3 {...stylex.props(styles.sectionTitle, ui.text)}&gt;{title}&lt;/h3&gt;
+       )}
+       &lt;div {...stylex.props(styles.sectionContent)}&gt;{children}&lt;/div&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   );
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Footer copyright component. Displays copyright information.
+  */
+ export interface FooterCopyrightProps
+   extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;React.ComponentProps&lt;"p"&gt;&gt; {}
+
+ export const FooterCopyright = ({
+   style,
+   children,
+   ...props
+ }: FooterCopyrightProps) =&gt; {
+   return (
+     &lt;p
+       {...props}
+       {...stylex.props(styles.copyright, ui.textDim, ui.borderDim, style)}
+     &gt;
+       {children}
+     &lt;/p&gt;
+   );
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Footer social link list component. Container for social media links.
+  */
+ export interface FooterSocialLinkListProps
+   extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;React.ComponentProps&lt;"nav"&gt;&gt; {}
+
+ export const FooterSocialLinkList = ({
+   style,
+   children,
+   ...props
+ }: FooterSocialLinkListProps) =&gt; {
+   return (
+     &lt;nav
+       {...props}
+       {...stylex.props(styles.socialLinkList, style)}
+       aria-label="Social links"
+     &gt;
+       {children}
+     &lt;/nav&gt;
+   );
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Footer social link item component. Individual social media link.
+  */
+ export interface FooterSocialLinkItemProps
+   extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;Omit&lt;AriaLinkProps, "children"&gt;&gt; {
+   /**
+    * Icon to display in the link. Typically from lucide-react.
+    */
+   icon?: React.ReactNode;
+   /**
+    * Accessible label for the link.
+    */
+   "aria-label": string;
+ }
+
+ export const FooterSocialLinkItem = ({
+   style,
+   icon,
+   children,
+   ...props
+ }: FooterSocialLinkItemProps) =&gt; {
+   return (
+     &lt;AriaLink
+       {...props}
+       {...stylex.props(styles.socialLinkItem, style)}
+       target="_blank"
+       rel="noopener noreferrer"
+     &gt;
+       {icon}
+       {children}
+     &lt;/AriaLink&gt;
+   );
+ };
+
+ /**
+  * Footer component with subcomponents.
+  */
+ export const Footer = {
+   Root: FooterRoot,
+   Section: FooterSection,
+   Copyright: FooterCopyright,
+   SocialLinkList: FooterSocialLinkList,
+   SocialLinkItem: FooterSocialLinkItem,
+ };
+
```

## Summary

1. **Created Footer Component** (`packages/hip-ui/src/components/footer/index.tsx`)
   - `Footer.Root` — main footer container with dark background styling
   - `Footer.Section` — container for footer content sections with optional title
   - `Footer.Copyright` — copyright text display with dimmed styling
   - `Footer.SocialLinkList` — container for social media links
   - `Footer.SocialLinkItem` — individual social media link with icon support
   - All components use theme tokens (spacing, colors, typography)
   - Exports both individual components and a namespace object (`Footer.Root`, etc.)

2. **Created Footer Config** (`packages/hip-ui/src/components/footer/footer-config.ts`)
   - Lists all theme dependencies
   - Includes react-aria-components dependency

3. **Registered Footer** (`packages/hip-ui/src/cli/install.tsx`)
   - Added import for `footerConfig`
   - Added `footerConfig` to `COMPONENT_CONFIGS` array

The component follows existing patterns:

- Uses StyleX with theme tokens
- Extends `StyleXComponentProps`
- Uses semantic HTML elements
- Includes TypeScript interfaces with JSDoc comments
- Uses "use client" directive
- No linting errors

Ready to build and install. The component matches the Tailwind UI dark footer example and is composable for flexible footer layouts.

```diff
+ title: Footer

+ ## Installation
+
+ Run the following command to add the footer component to your project.
+
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ pnpm hip install footer
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+
+ ## Props
+
+ This is a custom component built for footer layouts.
+
+ &lt;PropDocs components={["FooterRoot", "FooterSection", "FooterCopyright", "FooterSocialLinkList", "FooterSocialLinkItem"]} /&gt;
+
+ ## Features
+
+ ### With Sections
+
+ Organize footer content into sections with optional titles.
+
+ &lt;Example src={WithSections} /&gt;
+
+ ### With Social Links
+
+ Add social media links with icons to your footer.
+
+ &lt;Example src={WithSocialLinks} /&gt;
+
+ ## Components
+
+ - &#96;Footer.Root&#96; - The main footer container component
+ - &#96;Footer.Section&#96; - Container for grouping related footer content with optional title
+ - &#96;Footer.Copyright&#96; - Displays copyright information
+ - &#96;Footer.SocialLinkList&#96; - Container for social media links
+ - &#96;Footer.SocialLinkItem&#96; - Individual social media link with icon support
+
+ ## Related Components
+
+ - [Link](/docs/components/link) - For navigation links in footer sections
+ - [Navbar](/docs/components/navbar) - For site navigation
+ - [Grid](/docs/components/grid) - For multi-column footer layouts
+ - [Flex](/docs/components/flex) - For flexible footer layouts
+
```

## Documentation Created

1. **MDX Documentation** (`apps/docs/src/docs/components/navigation/footer.mdx`)
   - Installation instructions
   - Props documentation using PropDocs
   - Features section with examples
   - Component descriptions
   - Related components section

   - **basic.tsx** - Simple footer with sections and copyright
   - **with-social-links.tsx** - Footer with social media icons using lucide-react
   - **with-sections.tsx** - Multi-column footer layout using Grid component

The documentation follows the same structure as other components in the codebase:

- Uses the Example component to display live examples
- Includes PropDocs for all subcomponents
- Shows different use cases with separate example files
- Uses theme tokens (StyleX) instead of inline styles
- Follows the same formatting and structure as other component docs

The Footer component is now documented and ready to use.

```diff
@@ -7,14 +7,9 @@
  ## Component Creation Process

- To create a new hip component follow these steps:
-
- 1. **Research phase**: First ask if there is documentation for a headless component to look at (e.g., React Aria Components docs) Check https://component.gallery/ for similar implementation
- 2. **Component implementation**: Create the component in &#96;packages/hip-ui/src/components/[component-name]/index.tsx&#96;
- 3. **Config creation**: Create a config file &#96;[component-name]-config.ts&#96; in the same directory
- 4. **Register config**: Import and add the config to &#96;packages/hip-ui/src/cli/install.tsx&#96; in the &#96;COMPONENT_CONFIGS&#96; array
- 5. **Build**: Run the build command to compile the component
- 6. **Install**: Run &#96;pnpm hip install --all&#96; in the apps/docs directory
- 7. **Documentation**: Generate an &#96;.mdx&#96; page with examples in &#96;apps/docs/src/docs/components/[component-name].mdx&#96;
- 8. **Examples**: Create example files in &#96;apps/docs/src/examples/[component-name]/&#96; directory
+ 1. **Component implementation**: Create in &#96;packages/hip-ui/src/components/[component-name]/index.tsx&#96;
+ 2. **Config creation**: Create &#96;[component-name]-config.ts&#96; with all dependencies
+ 3. **Register config**: Add to &#96;packages/hip-ui/src/cli/install.tsx&#96; COMPONENT_CONFIGS array
+ 4. **Documentation**: Create &#96;.mdx&#96; in &#96;apps/docs/src/docs/components/[category]/[component-name].mdx&#96;
+ 5. **Examples**: Create examples in &#96;apps/docs/src/examples/[component-name]/&#96;

  ## Component Structure
```

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 19, lines removed: 35

```diff
@@ -82,47 +82,31 @@
  ### Styling

- - **Always use theme tokens** - Never hardcode colors, spacing, radius, shadows, or typography values
- - Use &#96;semantic-color.stylex.tsx&#96; for colors (&#96;ui.*&#96;, &#96;uiColor.*&#96;, &#96;uiInverted.*&#96;)
- - Use &#96;spacing.stylex.tsx&#96; for all spacing values
- - Use &#96;radius.stylex.tsx&#96; for border radius values
- - Use &#96;shadow.stylex.tsx&#96; for box shadows
- - Use &#96;typography.stylex.tsx&#96; for font styles
- - Use &#96;animations.stylex.tsx&#96; for transitions and animations
- - **Layout components**: Prefer &#96;Flex&#96; and &#96;Grid&#96; components over CSS for layout
- - **Size handling**: For composite components, use &#96;SizeContext&#96; to propagate size to child components. Only apply &#96;size&#96; prop to the root element
+ - **Always use theme tokens** - Never hardcode values
+ - Use &#96;semantic-color.stylex.tsx&#96; for colors (&#96;ui.*&#96;, &#96;uiColor.*&#96;)
+ - Use &#96;spacing.stylex.tsx&#96;, &#96;radius.stylex.tsx&#96;, &#96;typography.stylex.tsx&#96;, etc. for all values
+ - **Responsive styles**: Use &#96;breakpoints&#96; from &#96;media-queries.stylex.tsx&#96; (not &#96;mediaQueries&#96;)
+ - Prefer &#96;Flex&#96; and &#96;Grid&#96; components over CSS for layout
+ - Use &#96;SizeContext&#96; to propagate size to child components in composite components

  ### TypeScript

  - Always extend &#96;StyleXComponentProps&lt;BaseProps&gt;&#96; for component props
  - Use &#96;stylex.StyleXStyles&#96; for style props (never &#96;className&#96; or React &#96;style&#96;)
- - Export clear TypeScript interfaces with JSDoc comments for complex props
- - Use &#96;data-*&#96; attributes for conditional styling based on props (e.g., &#96;data-size={size}&#96;)
-
- ### React Aria Components
-
- - When using React Aria Components, extend the appropriate Aria component props
- - Preserve accessibility features from React Aria Components
- - Use React Aria's built-in hooks and state management when appropriate
- - Follow React Aria Component patterns for composition (e.g., &#96;DialogTrigger&#96;, &#96;Dialog&#96;, &#96;Modal&#96;, &#96;ModalOverlay&#96;)
-
- ### Icons
-
- - Use icons from &#96;lucide-react&#96; exclusively
- - Import icons as needed: &#96;import { IconName } from "lucide-react";&#96;
- - When used in a hip component the size does not need to be set
+ - Export TypeScript interfaces with JSDoc comments for complex props
+ - Use &#96;data-*&#96; attributes for conditional styling (e.g., &#96;data-size={size}&#96;)

  ### Component Composition

- - **Reuse existing components** - Prefer composing with existing hip components rather than redefining functionality
- - For composite components with multiple parts (e.g., Card, CardHeader, CardBody), export all related components from the same file
- - Use React Context (like &#96;SizeContext&#96;) for sharing props down the component tree when appropriate
-
- ### Client Components
-
- - Add &#96;"use client"&#96; directive at the top of files that:
-   - Use React hooks (&#96;useState&#96;, &#96;useEffect&#96;, etc.)
-   - Handle user interactions
-   - Use React Context
-   - Import from &#96;react-aria-components&#96; (most components need this)
+ - For composite components (e.g., Footer, Card), export both:
+   1. Individual components: &#96;export const FooterRoot = ...&#96;
+   2. Namespace object: &#96;export const Footer = { Root: FooterRoot, ... }&#96;
+ - This allows both &#96;Footer.Root&#96; and &#96;FooterRoot&#96; usage patterns
+ - Export all related subcomponents from the same file
+
+ ### React Aria &amp; Icons
+
+ - Extend appropriate Aria component props when using React Aria Components
+ - Use icons from &#96;lucide-react&#96; exclusively (size handled automatically)
+ - Add &#96;"use client"&#96; directive for hooks, interactions, or react-aria-components

  ## Documentation Structure
```

</details>

</tool-use>

Updated and condensed the `hip-component.mdc` rule file. Changes:

## Updates

1. **Condensed Component Creation Process** — Reduced from 8 steps to 5 essential steps

2. **Added namespace pattern guidance** — Shows how to export both individual components and a namespace object for composite components:

   ```typescript
   export const FooterRoot = ...;
   export const Footer = { Root: FooterRoot, ... };
   ```

3. **Fixed responsive styles** — Explicitly states to use `breakpoints` from `media-queries.stylex.tsx` (not `mediaQueries`)

4. **Simplified examples** — Removed redundant code examples and kept only essential patterns

5. **Condensed rules sections** — Combined related rules (React Aria & Icons, Component Composition) for better readability

6. **Updated documentation structure** — Shows the category path pattern (`navigation/footer.mdx`)

7. **Streamlined checklist** — Reduced from 11 items to 8 essential checks

The rule is now more concise while capturing the patterns used in the Footer component, including the namespace export pattern and correct responsive breakpoint usage.

   - `FooterSectionProps` → `FooterNavSectionProps`
   - `FooterSection` → `FooterNavSection`

     - `basic.tsx`
     - `with-social-links.tsx`
     - `with-sections.tsx`

```diff
+  * Footer section component. Generic container for footer content with max-width, margin, and padding.

+  */
+ export interface FooterSectionProps
+   extends StyleXComponentProps&lt;React.ComponentProps&lt;"div"&gt;&gt; {}
+
+ export const FooterSection = ({ style, ...props }: FooterSectionProps) =&gt; {
+   return (
+     &lt;div
+       {...props}
+       {...stylex.props(styles.footerSection, ui.borderDim, style)}
+     /&gt;
+   );
+ };
```

## Changes Made

1. **Added `FooterSection` component** with:
   - Max-width: `1280px` (centered with auto margins)
   - Padding: `spacing["8"]` top/bottom, `spacing["4"]` left/right
   - Conditional bottom border: dim border (`uiColor.border1`) only if not the last child

2. **Updated both component files**:
   - `packages/hip-ui/src/components/footer/index.tsx`
   - `apps/docs/src/components/footer/index.tsx`

3. **Updated namespace object** to include `Section: FooterSection`

4. **Updated documentation** to include `FooterSection` in PropDocs and component descriptions

The component uses StyleX conditional styling with `:not(:last-child)` to add the bottom border only when it's not the last section. The border uses `uiColor.border1` for a dim appearance.

You can now use `Footer.Section` as a generic container that handles layout constraints and visual separation between sections.

## Changes Made

1. **FooterSection layout**:
   - Added `display: flex`, `flexDirection: row`, `justifyContent: space-between`, `alignItems: center`
   - Copyright on the left, social icons on the right

2. **Copyright styling**:
   - Changed from `textAlign: "center"` to `textAlign: "left"`
   - Removed top padding and border
   - Set `margin: 0`

3. **Rounded corners**:
   - Added `borderRadius: radius["lg"]` to FooterSection

4. **Spacing**:
   - Adjusted padding to `spacing["6"]` (responsive to `spacing["8"]` on larger screens)

The footer now matches the first image:

- Dark background (via `ui.bgSubtle` on FooterRoot)
- Copyright text on the left in light gray (`ui.textDim`)
- Social media icons on the right in light gray
- Rounded corners
- Horizontal layout with proper spacing

The `with-social-links` example already uses this layout, so it should display correctly.

---

---

Fixed the breakpoint structure. In StyleX, breakpoints should be top-level keys in the style object, not nested inside property objects.

Changed from:

```typescript
paddingLeft: {
  default: spacing["4"],
  [breakpoints.sm]: spacing["6"],
},
```

To:

```typescript
paddingLeft: spacing["4"],
[breakpoints.sm]: {
  paddingLeft: spacing["6"],
},
```

This matches the StyleX pattern: base styles first, then breakpoint keys override properties at those media queries. Updated in both the packages and apps/docs versions.

```
paddingLeft: {
```

Renamed `NavSection` to `NavGroup` across all files:

1. **Component files** (both packages and apps/docs):
   - `FooterNavSectionProps` → `FooterNavGroupProps`
   - `FooterNavSection` → `FooterNavGroup`
   - Updated namespace: `NavSection: FooterNavSection` → `NavGroup: FooterNavGroup`
   - Updated JSDoc comments from "section" to "group"

2. **Example files**:
   - Updated all `Footer.NavSection` usages to `Footer.NavGroup` in `with-sections.tsx`

3. **Documentation**:
   - Updated PropDocs component name from `FooterNavSection` to `FooterNavGroup`
   - Updated component description from `Footer.NavSection` to `Footer.NavGroup`

All references are updated with no linting errors. The component now uses `Footer.NavGroup` instead of `Footer.NavSection`.

---

Created the new `Footer.NavSection` component. Summary:

1. **Added `navSection` style** with responsive grid:
   - Default (small screens): `repeat(2, 1fr)` — 2 columns (2x2 grid)
   - Large screens (`breakpoints.lg`): `repeat(4, 1fr)` — 4 columns (4x1 grid)
   - Column gap: `spacing["8"]`
   - Row gap: `spacing["4"]`

2. **Created `FooterNavSection` component**:
   - Responsive grid container
   - Accepts standard StyleX props

3. **Updated namespace** to include `NavSection: FooterNavSection`

4. **Updated example** (`with-sections.tsx`):
   - Replaced the `Grid` component with `Footer.NavSection`
   - Removed the Grid import

The component automatically switches from a 2-column grid on smaller screens to a 4-column grid on larger screens (at the `lg` breakpoint, 64rem/1024px). Updated in both the packages and apps/docs versions.

Added the `Footer.Logo` component and updated the examples. Summary:

1. **Added `FooterLogo` component**:
   - Simple wrapper component that accepts children
   - Uses flexbox for alignment
   - Added to both packages and apps/docs versions

2. **Added to namespace**: `Logo: FooterLogo` in the Footer namespace object

3. **Updated examples**:
   - Added the `Logo` function component (copied from navbar example) to both `basic.tsx` and `with-social-links.tsx`
   - Wrapped the Logo in `<Footer.Logo>` in both examples

The `Footer.Logo` component accepts any children, so users can pass their own logo SVG or image. The examples now include the circular logo SVG from the navbar example.

---

Added the `isCentered` prop to `Footer.Root`. Changes:

1. **Added `rootCentered` style**:
   - Uses flexbox with `flexDirection: "column"` to stack content vertically
   - `alignItems: "center"` to center items horizontally
   - `textAlign: "center"` to center text content

2. **Updated `FooterRootProps` interface**:
   - Added optional `isCentered?: boolean` prop with JSDoc comment

3. **Updated `FooterRoot` component**:
   - Conditionally applies `rootCentered` style when `isCentered` is true

4. **Updated both versions**: packages and apps/docs

When `isCentered` is set to `true` on `Footer.Root`, all footer content will be centered. The prop is optional, so existing usage remains unchanged.

---

---

Added the subscription components. Summary:

1. **Footer.Subscribe** — Container with `variant` prop:
   - `variant="vertical"` (default): stacks title, description, and input vertically
   - `variant="horizontal"`: title/description on left, input on right

2. **Footer.SubscribeTitle** — Title heading component

3. **Footer.SubscribeDescription** — Description text component

4. **Footer.SubscribeInput** — Form component with:
   - Email `TextField` (no label)
   - Subscribe `Button`
   - `onSubmit` callback prop
   - `placeholder` prop (default: "Enter your email")
   - `buttonText` prop (default: "Subscribe")
   - Input field uses `flex: "1"` to take remaining space

5. **Updated config** — Added `button` and `text-field` to `hipDependencies`

6. **Updated namespace** — Added all four subscribe components to the Footer namespace

All components use theme tokens and follow the existing patterns. The horizontal variant aligns items to `flex-end` so the input aligns with the bottom of the title/description section, matching the reference images.

```diff
+       &lt;Footer.Section&gt;

+           &lt;Footer.SubscribeTitle&gt;Subscribe to our newsletter&lt;/Footer.SubscribeTitle&gt;
```

Added examples for the subscription components. Summary:

1. **Created two example files**:
   - `with-subscribe-vertical.tsx` - Shows the vertical variant (default)
   - `with-subscribe-horizontal.tsx` - Shows the horizontal variant with title/description on left and input on right

2. **Updated the MDX documentation**:
   - Added imports for both new examples
   - Added two new feature sections: "With Subscribe (Vertical)" and "With Subscribe (Horizontal)"
   - Updated PropDocs to include all the new subscribe components
   - Updated the Components list to include all footer subcomponents including the new subscribe ones

The examples demonstrate:

- Using `Footer.Subscribe` with both variants
- Using `Footer.SubscribeTitle` and `Footer.SubscribeDescription`
- Using `Footer.SubscribeInput` with an `onSubmit` handler
- Proper form handling with FormData

Both examples include a simple alert on submit to show the form is working. The horizontal example wraps the title and description in a div so they stack vertically on the left side while the input stays on the right.

---

Updated `Footer.Subscribe` to use CSS Grid with named template areas. Changes:

1. **Updated `subscribe` styles**:
   - Switched from flexbox to CSS Grid
   - Vertical: single column with areas `"title"`, `"description"`, `"input"` stacked
   - Horizontal: two rows with `"title input"` and `"description input"` (input spans both rows)
   - Uses `data-subscribe-variant` attribute for conditional styling

2. **Added `gridArea` to child components**:
   - `subscribeTitle`: `gridArea: "title"`
   - `subscribeDescription`: `gridArea: "description"`
   - `subscribeInput`: `gridArea: "input"`

3. **Updated the component**:
   - Removed the `subscribeHorizontal` style
   - Uses `data-subscribe-variant` attribute instead of conditional style application

4. **Updated the example**:
   - Removed the wrapper `<div>` around title and description
   - Title, description, and input are direct children of `Footer.Subscribe`

The horizontal variant now uses a grid where the input spans both rows on the right, and the title and description stack on the left, without needing a wrapper div.

---

Created a comprehensive example that includes all Footer subcomponents:

1. **Created** `apps/docs/src/examples/footer/comprehensive.tsx` with:
   - `Footer.Root` as the container
   - `Footer.Logo` with the logo SVG
   - `Footer.Section` (multiple sections)
   - `Footer.NavSection` with responsive grid
   - `Footer.NavGroup` (4 groups: Product, Company, Resources, Legal)
   - `Footer.Subscribe` with horizontal variant
   - `Footer.SubscribeTitle`, `Footer.SubscribeDescription`, and `Footer.SubscribeInput`
   - `Footer.Copyright`
   - `Footer.SocialLinkList` with multiple `Footer.SocialLinkItem` components

2. **Added** the example to the documentation at the top of the page, before the Installation section, so it appears as the main example.

The example demonstrates all Footer subcomponents in a single footer layout.

---
